column2: Danielsen, Swintha & Noé Gasparini. 2016. News on the Jorá (Tupí-Guaraní): sociolinguistics, description, and classification. Boletim do Museu Paraense Emílio Goeldi.
Danielsen proposes underlying N and (1) local oralization process where N postoralizes to ND and D preceding an oral vowel

Phones are from a chart on p. 465-466 with confidence levels 1-5: (1 = most certain ; 2 = not so sure ; 3 = unsure ; 4 = no phonemic evidence ; 5 = not in the corpus but may be in the language knowing Siriono and Yuki). The phonemes with confidence leves other than 1 are: /d/ (2), /ɾ/ with allophone [ɾ ~ l](4), /f/ (4), /ʃ/ (4), /gʷ/ (2), /ŋɡ/ with allophone [g] (3), /ɲ/ (5), /h/ with allophone [h] (2), /h/ with allophone [x] (4), /ʔ/ (2), /ɨ̃/ with allophone [ə̃] (4), /ẽ/ (5)

column3: Why? 1) no real phonological analysis 2) data and analysis of rather dubious quality

Postoralization (or sometimes full oralization) of N preceding oral V
We adopt Danielsen & Gasparini's analysis for Jorá: post-oralization or complete oralization of underlying nasal consonants preceding an oral vowel.
